question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Solve
\[\frac{(x + 7)(x - 2)}{x - 1} < 0.\]Enter your answer using interval notation.
inference:
**Solution:**
\[\frac{(x + 7)(x - 2)}{x - 1} < 0\]

The numerator is positive when $x > -7$ and $x < 2$. The denominator is positive when $x > 1$. So the fraction is negative when $x > 2$ and $x < 1$.

**Final Answer: \\boxed{$(1, 2)$}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
We can build a sign chart:

\[
\begin{array}{c|cccc}
& x < -7 & -7 < x < 1 & 1 < x < 2 & 2 < x \\ \hline
x + 7 & - & + & + & + \\
x - 1 & - & - & + & + \\
x - 2 & - & - & - & + \\
\frac{(x + 7)(x - 2)}{x - 1} & - & + & - & +
\end{array}
\]Thus, the solution is $x \in \boxed{(-\infty,-7) \cup (1,2)}.$
